Few garments are immune from fashion’s fickleness, but the best leather jackets for men continue to pass through each season unscathed. Why? Not only totally badass, they take many forms, from truckers to bombers, and possess that unique wearability that means they can be paired with pretty much anything, anywhere. Join me as I round up the different options available, highlighting the cream of the crop for every style, budget, and occasion. Key Takeaways A must-have for every wardrobe, the leather jacket is versatile, durable, and undeniably cool. Much like its denim counterpart, it carries a legacy of rugged masculinity and has been famously worn by menswear mavericks such as Marlon Brando, James Dean, and Steve McQueen. After combing through countless reviews, ratings, and Reddit forums, I’ve handpicked the best leather jackets for men, focusing on the five-star styles that’ll become the foundation of your finest fits for decades. Here you’ll find a selection of standouts, including Billy Reid’s Blake jacket and Luca Faloni’s suede bomber. The Dos And Don’ts Of Leather Jackets Do condition your jacket regularly to keep the leather soft, prevent cracking, and maintain its natural sheen. Use a quality leather conditioner every few months to ensure longevity. Do hang your jacket on a sturdy hanger to preserve its shape, avoiding wire hangers that can create creases and distort the shoulders over time. Don’t expose your jacket to excessive moisture as water can damage the leather and lead to discoloration. If it gets wet, let it air dry naturally and avoid using direct heat sources like radiators or hairdryers. Don’t store your jacket in plastic garment bags as leather needs to breathe. If you want to keep it protected in your wardrobe, opt for a breathable fabric cover that’ll allow decent air circulation. In This Article Our PicksBuying ConsiderationsHow We ChoseWhy Trust Us? The Dos And Don’ts Of Leather Jackets

Do condition your jacket regularly to keep the leather soft, prevent cracking, and maintain its natural sheen. Use a quality leather conditioner every few months to ensure longevity.

Do hang your jacket on a sturdy hanger to preserve its shape, avoiding wire hangers that can create creases and distort the shoulders over time.

Don’t expose your jacket to excessive moisture as water can damage the leather and lead to discoloration. If it gets wet, let it air dry naturally and avoid using direct heat sources like radiators or hairdryers.

Don’t store your jacket in plastic garment bags as leather needs to breathe. If you want to keep it protected in your wardrobe, opt for a breathable fabric cover that’ll allow decent air circulation.

What Makes The Best Leather Jackets for Men?

Quality

The quality of the leather is key to finding the best leather jackets for men. Full-grain and top-grain leather are considered the most premium options, offering superior durability and a rich texture that improves with age. Full-grain leather retains its natural imperfections, giving the jacket character, whereas top-grain leather is slightly sanded for a smoother finish.

Fit

A well-fitting leather jacket is essential for both style and comfort. The jacket should be snug without feeling restrictive, enhancing your natural silhouette while allowing room for layering. Make sure that the shoulders align properly and the sleeves end just at the wrist. If you plan to wear it frequently, consider trying different cuts—such as slim-fit or relaxed—until you find the one that suits your body type and provides a comfortable range of motion.

Style

Leather jackets come in a range of styles, from rugged biker jackets to sleek bombers and minimalist racer jackets. When choosing, think about how it fits into your wardrobe and lifestyle. A classic brown or black leather jacket offers timeless appeal and can be paired with anything from jeans and a T-shirt to a turtleneck and smart slacks. Versatility is key, so pick a design that works for different occasions and seasons, ensuring that you get the most use out of your investment.
